author: Special Correspondent
text:
The release of water from Mettur Dam into the dam’s east-west canal for farm activities in the western districts was stopped with effect from Monday.

The east-west canal system covered about 45,000 acres in the three districts of Salem (16,433 acres), Namakkal (11,337 acres) and Erode (17,230 acres).

Water was released from Mettur dam into east-west canal on August 20 and the release was continued without any break.

Initially, about 500 cusecs was released in the first phase, and it was stepped up to 1,000 cusecs later. About 400 cusecs of water was let out in the canal for the past few weeks.

With the farm activities’ coming to an end, the release of water was stopped on Monday, Public Works Department sources told The Hindu.

Meanwhile, the water level in the Mettur Dam went down further and stood at 74.36 feet on Monday against its full level of 120 feet.

The storage level of the dam was 36.565 tmc against its full capacity of 93.470 tmc. The dam was receiving an inflow of 185 cusecs. About 6,000 cusecs of water is being released from the dam for farm activities in Cauvery Delta districts.
title: Water release from Mettur Dam stopped
